conways.game.of.life

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • conways.game.of.life.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The world that holds the cells of the simulation.
    Author:
    ssyl55

      World(int width, int height)
      Initializes the world state.

      Iterates the world back a step.

      Populates the world by adding a cell object that is in the "off" state at each position on the world grid.

      Sets a new world height.

      void step()
      Steps to the next iteration of the simulation by calling the evolve method on every cell in the grid.

    • Method Detail

      • populateWorld

        public void populateWorld()
        Populates the world by adding a cell object that is in the "off" state at each position on the world grid.

      • populateWorld

        public void populateWorld(Cell[][] initialState)
        Populates the world with an initial state that is passed into the method. Used to initialize the world to certain presets.
        Parameters:
        initialState - the initial state of the world.

      • randomInitialize

        public void randomInitialize()
        Randomly initializes the state of the world.

      • step

        public void step()
        Steps to the next iteration of the simulation by calling the evolve method on every cell in the grid.

      • iterateBackwards

        public void iterateBackwards()
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Iterates the world back a step.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if there are no more previous states of the world.

      • draw

        public void draw(Cell[][] dGrid)
        Drawing code to stdout in place now before drawing to the GUI is implemented. For testing purposes.
        Parameters:
        dGrid - the grid to draw to stdout.
